required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficiency of γδ T Cell Against Hematological Malignancies After Allo-HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficiency of γδ T Cell Against Hematological Malignancies After Allo-HSCT. A Dose Escalation, Open-label, Phase 1/2 Study.

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the infusion safety and potential curative properties of ex-vivo expanded γδ T cells obtained from the same donor for patients who have hematological malignancies and have accepted allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-center, open-label, single-arm study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ex-vivo expanded γδ T cell in patients with hematological malignancies after allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation. γδ T cell will be separated from peripheral blood of the same donors. After expansion in vitro, they will be infused to the patients as an immunotherapy treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This dose escalation study will be conducted in two phases. The first phase will have 3 cohorts(Dose escalation, x5 dose increments between cohorts, 2×10^6、 1×10^7/kg and 5×10^7 of cells per kg of body weight). The second phase is an expansion cohort at the maximum tolerated dose determined in the first phase.

primary_outcome.description: Safety of γδ T cell assessed by incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (AEs) per patient graded by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0.
Tolerability of γδ T cell assessed by incidence of dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) graded by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients reaching Complete Remission (CR) [Efficacy]
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of ex-vivo expanded γδ T cell assessed by number of patients reaching Complete Remission (CR).
Efficacy of ex-vivo expanded γδ T cell assessed by overall survival (OS) measured in months.
Quality of life determined by European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire 'C30'.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before treatment and up to 3 months after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Persistence of γδ T cell assessed by number in peripheral blood.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with hematological malignancies after allo-HSCT
arm_group.description: Patients with negative minimal residual disease or stable disease: After inclusion, patients will receive or not receive chemotherapy. Subsequently, patients will be dosed with γδ T cell. Patients with positive minimal residual disease but not hematologic relapse: After inclusion, patients will receive chemotherapy. Subsequently, patients will be dosed with γδ T cell. Patients with hematologic relapse: After inclusion, patients will receive chemotherapy. Subsequently, patients will be dosed with γδ T cell.

intervention.intervention_name: Ex-vivo expanded γδ T cell infusion
intervention.description: Phase 1: Patients receive ex-vivo expanded γδ T cell (Dose escalation, 3 cohorts, x5 dose increments between cohorts, 2×10^6、 1×10^7 and 5×10^7 of cells per kg of body weight). Phase 2: Patients receive ex-vivo expanded γδ T cell at the maximum tolerated dose determined in Phase 1.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with hematological malignancies after allo-HSCT
